events.event_description: U.S. finished motor gasoline consumption reached 8.95 million barrels per day, with production of 9.65 million b/d plus imports of 118,000 b/d, while exports were 816,000 b/d.
events.citation: We calculate that, in 2023, finished motor gasoline product supplied in the United States came from 9.65 million barrels per day (b/d) of finished net production by refiners, blenders, and biofuels plants plus 118,000 b/d of imports. Disposition of finished motor gasoline included a 3,000 b/d increase in primary inventories and 816,000 b/d of finished motor gasoline exports.

events.event_description: EIA's Weekly Petroleum Status Report (WPSR) and Petroleum Supply Monthly (PSM) showed minimal differences in product supplied estimates, averaging close to 0% difference over an extended period.
events.citation: Usually, the WPSR product supplied is within +/-2% of the PSM. Over longer periods, these differences can average close to 0%, as they did from 2018 through June 2024.

events.event_description: A supply adjustment reduced finished motor gasoline supply by 7,000 barrels per day to balance differences between supply and disposition data.
events.citation: The adjustment serves as a balancing item, which reduced finished motor gasoline supply by 7,000 b/d in 2023.
